<Text: In Greek mythology, Botres was a Theban son of Eumelus and grandson of Eugnotus.>

Text: Botres:  His father venerated the god Apollo devotedly and honored him with generous offerings.

<Text: Botres:  One day, when Eumelus was sacrificing a ram to the god, Botres, who was helping around, tasted the victim's brain before the ritual was completed.>

Text: Botres:  As it became evident that Botres was dying, Eumelus, his wife and the servants were overcome with sorrow.

Text: Botres:  Being that Eumelus was a devotee, Apollo took pity on them and changed Botres into a bird called "Aeropus" (bee-eater).
